Oh shit! #HRtweets https://t.co/tGz2JU768O

@Mamaofabean @IDontBlog Found the MH tweets. She got slayed HARD for her comment. Even “experts” (in what?) can have flawed opinions that end up backfiring on the very feminism they purport to uphold. She fell into this logical fallacy hole face first, unfortunately. https://t.co/pIzMIbfnkz

@Mamaofabean @JulieSLalonde @IDontBlog Yes, I follow her here and there. Didn’t see her comments about Heinen? It doesn’t change my perspective on due process however. I don’t believe due process should ever be ignored because it’s too critical to our justice system.

@Mamaofabean @JulieSLalonde @IDontBlog Hmm. She wasn’t making reference at all to Marie Henein or other lawyers. She was referring to male colleagues Ghomeshi’s workplace to testify on his behalf. Colleagues don’t have any legal obligations to withhold judgement & defend him. Apple vs orange.
@Mamaofabean @IDontBlog I wasn’t referring to you.
Better a string up my ass than the whole back of the underwear, I always say. 🤷🏻‍♀️ #BootyProblems https://t.co/GRDh7Chfu3
@emiiilyt Whatever mom is willing to pay for. That’s what. 😏
@IDontBlog @Mamaofabean Except you called her a “monster by proxy” so, if that’s not blame-y then I’m not sure what that means exactly.

@IDontBlog @Mamaofabean Where we differ is that you seem to believe feminists owe women otherwise “betrayal” whereas I don’t believe they owe anybody anything. To me, feminism means women are free to do/be whatever a man can do/be. Men don’t shame each other for betraying their sex. Same difference.

@Mamaofabean @IDontBlog Same ethical standards doctors have to take on the grossest possible patients or psychologists have to take on the most severe mental illness cases. Choosing is UNETHICAL. They have a professional duty to provide care/service in accordance with their standards of practice.

@Mamaofabean @IDontBlog It’s not that simple. She has an ethical duty to take on clients to defend and not prejudge them. That’s not her role ever. That was completely cave our judicial system of lawyers played that card.

@Mamaofabean @IDontBlog I respect that she does NOT play judge and jury all by herself. That kind of premature bias is also very troublesome in our legal system. I would want to know my lawyer has my back fully & does their job, regardless of their personal feelings about me (right or wrong).

@Mamaofabean @IDontBlog But you don’t know the situation until AFTER the trial. At least, not in cases where it’s not so obvious. To suggest you don’t respect a lawyer for seeing due process through doesn’t make sense to me.

@drflanders Oh oh I wanna play!

RT @HeneinHutchison: Doug Ford, no power grab is worth undermining Canada’s solid foundation /via @globeandmail https://t.co/uoH5U8r6ey
@JessLint I loooooove babies. And now I looooove giving them back to other people 😁
@IDontBlog @Mamaofabean *autocorrect, the judge not jury.
@JessLint If I wasn’t allergic to cats I would literally surround myself with kittens!! 😍

@IDontBlog @Mamaofabean I hold the courts responsible for the decision. Marie is no more responsible than the complacent male plaintiff lawyer is for not protecting his client. But of course, nobody talks about him. Misaligned focus begets the shift.

@IDontBlog @Mamaofabean I respect her for being a true professional, not subjecting her clients to bias or prejudgment, for holding court like a boss in front of all that media hype, for not giving a fuck what people think about her vagina/hair/outfit/shoes and bringing her lawyer A-game.

@IDontBlog @Mamaofabean Can you imagine if we had a system where all defendants were ‘gut judged’ as guilty or innocent before they even got to court based on... feelings? Wow. She did her job well - as she should. Focus instead should be on the jury that acquitted him. Herein lies the reason he walks.

@IDontBlog @Mamaofabean My own armchair opinions aside, defending clients well is part of being a good criminal defensive attorney. Ultimately it’s for the courts to decide “monster status” based on all the evidence. She did her job - the jury/court is responsible for the decision in the end.

@IDontBlog @Mamaofabean Here’s her talk about #metoo ... it explains more about the perspective she takes & addresses the ironic criticisms that she somehow betrayed women simply “because she is a woman”. It’s really very good... https://t.co/SxnJQERBvg

@IDontBlog @Mamaofabean I loved reading about her post-trial, missed attending her talks to women leaders but was impressed with the way she handled judgement & expectations of her simply for being a woman (especially by other women): https://t.co/3ZdW5wMFYI

@marissa_catena I don’t think E will ever lose his teeth, lol. His baby teeth look sooo small in his head right now. He’s almost all gums it’s hilarious. He got his FIRST tooth at age one, so he’s just a slow toother ;)

@IDontBlog @Mamaofabean If Marie Heinen was a man, nobody would be having this convo. I think we need to be aware of holding women to “moral standards” we don’t equally hold men to. Jian’s the person with morality issues. Marie was doing her job like all other lawyers do.

@MissTwosday @Forbes @ADP As a Black Canadian however, I can appreciate we don’t share the exact same history in our country. Still plenty of implicit bias over here, which I’ve been working in the field for 20 years.
@MissTwosday @Forbes Speaking of implicit bias... you have made many assumptions about me already. The irony. Calm down, girl. I am on your side no matter your perception of my profile pic.
@MissTwosday @Forbes You don’t need to overcompensate here. You are preaching to the choir. ✌🏼

@MissTwosday @Forbes Nah. I would put women in this category too. Plenty of oppression towards women as well. Including a history of no rights and ongoing violence. Women of colour IMO are at the top of this list.
@MissTwosday @Forbes @ADP You don’t have to like the technical definition of implicit bias, but it is what it is. It doesn’t take away from the severity of what happened to Black Americans.

@MissTwosday @Forbes I totally understand the feelings behind your perspective (I am also Black over here friend), but no - that’s not what implicit bias is limited to. Implicit bias can include associations towards any social group, notably the most obvious such as skin colour or gender.

@MissTwosday @Forbes @ADP I think everyone should take it since unconscious bias goes well beyond just skin colour: disabilities, sexual orientation, gender, etc. Sadly, being a person of colour does not protect us from unconscious bias, even within communities of colour.

@Mamaofabean It might actually be a “man” thing that you’re sensing more than a racial thing. I was the same for both as well. Their second test below does a more thorough job at measuring racial bias specifically: https://t.co/3AB2M7KacX
As if this woman could be any more fierce as fuck. LOVE HER. #leadership https://t.co/mQrNYyEYPN

@Mamaofabean People who expect things to move quickly all the time have literally grown up in a very tiny bubble. Sure. Everything is easy & fast in a fishbowl echo chamber. But complexity requires thought, strategy, the ability to see around corners & responsibly should be given this time.
